title: Tips and Tricks for the DataStax Astra CLI
description:
Want to 10x your vector DB tasks with DataStax Astra DB? This video will show you how to supercharge your GenAI development!

Blog post: https://www.datastax.com/blog/tips-and-tricks-for-the-datastax-astra-cli

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastaxdevs?sub_confirmation=1 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastaxdevs
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/datastaxdevs

About DataStax:
DataStax is the company behind the massively scalable, highly available, cloud-native NoSQL data platform built on Apache Cassandra™. DataStax gives developers and enterprises the freedom to run data in any cloud, Kubernetes, hybrid or bare metal at global scale with zero downtime and zero lock-in. More than 450 of the world’s leading enterprises including Capital One, Cisco, Comcast, Delta Airlines, Macy’s, McDonald’s, Safeway, Sony, and Walmart use DataStax to build transformational data architectures for real-world outcomes. For more, visit DataStax.com and @DataStax.

About DataStax Developer:
On the DataStax Developers YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, workshops and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on Apache Cassandra©.  Visit https://datastax.com/dev for more free learning resources.

transcript.text: hello everyone I'm Erin plz from data stack and welcome to tips and tricks for the data stack astris CLI in this short video I'm going to show you several examples of how the Astra CLI can help to 10x your generative AI database tasks and help to get you back to focusing on what you do best writing code and building your gen apps let's go so when we're using the Astra CLI we must remember remember to prepend all commands with Astra space DB then the command and then the database name this is the format we'll use going forward we're going to start by using the astb list command this will show us all of our available databases from here you might have noticed that the react Miami 2024 database has a status of hibernated if we want to use this database we need to resume it first for that we can use Astra DB resume followed by your database name of react Miami 2024 this might take a minute or two but eventually it should come back and your database should be resumed next we're going to look at creating a collection in our database to do this we'll use the Astra DB create collection command now here we're going to specify your database as well as an option for the collection name the number of dimensions for our vector embeddings and of course the similarity metric that we'll use for Vector searches all right that collection's ready now if we wanted to have a look at the collections we have in our database we could do a list collections command as you can see our new Vector data collection is indeed there now let's say that we wanted to remove or delete a collection for this we can use the D delete collection command and again we'll specify the database as well as the collection name and once that's complete we can go ahead and run the list collections command one more time just to verify that it is gone sometimes when building a gen app we want to keep the collection but get rid of the data to do this we can invoke the truncate command via cql shell in this case we're going to specify our default keyspace and then a DOT and then the name of our collection as we pass that to the truncate table command this will go ahead and pipe the instruction through cql shell thus getting rid of our data for more information be sure to check out as. data.com for your free astrab account as well as the companion blog found at data.com blog tips and tricks for the datax Astra CLI
